newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Caracas shares closed mixed, cross trades dominate.
newsitem.headline: Caracas shares closed mixed, cross trades dominate.

text.p: Share prices on the Caracas Stock Exchange closed mixed, with the index hitting its fifth successive fall Wednesday in action dominated by large cross trades, brokers said.
The market's 19-share index fell 0.09 percent to 4,580.37, as 20 stocks closed higher, 16 lower and eight unchanged.
Trading volume was twice that on Tuesday at 8.614 billion bolivars ($18.1 million) in a session again dominated by cross trades, or trades between portfolios in the same brokerage.
"The volume was so high because of the number of cross trades," said Ricardo Marino of the Intervalores brokerage.
Brokers said foreign buyers appeared to be behind most of the cross trades.

Among leading stocks, benchmark Electricidad de Caracas fell 3.00 bolivars to 391.00 bolivars, steel company Sivensa rose 0.50 bolivar to 289.75 bolivars and agro-industrial company Mavesa rose 1.50 bolivars to 122.00.
